clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Probiotics on Vancomycin-Resistant Enterococcus
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Probiotics on Vancomycin-Resistant Enterococcus

brief_summary.textblock: Drinking probiotics in a the form of a yogurt drink will restore normal gastrointestinal (GI) bacteria in patients whose colon are colonized with vancomycin-resistant enterococcus (VRE).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Whether a positive VRE colonized patient becomes VRE negative after drinking yogurt with probiotics

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustainable effects of probiotics on VRE colonization
Any positive or negative effects on patients' hospital stay.

intervention.description: 100 gms of a yogurt drink containing probiotics will be given to pVRE positive patients for 4 weeks
100 gms of pasteurized yogurt drinks with no live cultures will be given to VRE positive patients for 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- VRE positive patients with GI colonization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years
- Patients who have had a bone marrow transplant
- Extreme short bowel patients (less than 100 cm small bowel remaining)
- Patients with active VRE infection but no GI colonization
- Patients unable to eat and have no feeding access
- Patients who do not have a power of attorney to give consent if they are unable to
